name: 2,4,6-tris-(trifluoromethyl)-1,3,5-triazine
Reason: Basic unit, 1,3,5-triazine has a melting point of 81°C. Each trifluoromethyl (CF3) group contributes a decrease in melting point due to the introduction of highly electronegative fluorine atoms which weaken the crystal lattice by disrupting π-π stacking interactions typically present in aromatic systems. This is counterintuitive as fluorine’s strong inductive effect often increases melting point in other types of compounds. For 1,3,5-triazine, the effect of each trifluoromethyl group is around -35°C. Thus, for three CF3 groups, the total decrease is approximately -105°C.
